website_summaries.verdict: The SmartThings Tracker is great for tracking things you really care about, but you'll need to be on board with making monthly cell service payments.
pros: This cellular-powered tracker keeps an eye on your stuff with a broader scope than Bluetooth, and it can even trigger smart home actions
cons: It's a pricey way to track, with a $100 price tag and $5-per-month service plan

customer_reviews.title: Samsung Failure
customer_reviews.text: Really wanted this tracker to work due that it's a samsung but it would be it hook to my samsung s9+phone . Spent 3 hours on the phone with a tack and she turned it over to a specialist that never responded. Shame on you Samsung.
customer_reviews.author: jonjoshjakejed

customer_reviews.title: Won’t connect
customer_reviews.text: Yeah, this thing is useless if I have to turn it on and re-connect every day before use. It has power, but it just kept disconnecting, and only way to reconnect is to press the button and let it process for like 30 mins. I’m returning this junk.
customer_reviews.author: GS

customer_reviews.title: Track my kids anywhere
customer_reviews.text: Finally a good tracker which doesn't go out of range. My 2nd grader now has it on her backpack. Lets me know where she is at all times. Came with a year of coverage.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan

customer_reviews.title: Not compatible with Android Pie
customer_reviews.text: Great concept but it cannot be used with Android Pie, Pixel 2xl in my case. You can register the tracker however you need to download a controller in app to actually use it. All download attempts result in "Couldn't download controller" a well documented issue on community forums.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Agro

customer_reviews.title: A must have!
customer_reviews.text: The Tracker is fantastic. It's perfect for keeping tabs on all the things that matter to you and gives me that peace of mind. My dog loves to sneak out of the house and I used to have a SmartThings Arrival sensor on his collar so I get alerted from SmartThings when he leaves the geofence but it does not tell me where he is out of the house. Now, with the SmartThings Tracker, I can get alerts when he sneaks out and have his exact location. Also, it's great that it is water resistant and dust proof. You also can't beat the price and have 1 year of service included!
customer_reviews.author: CZ

customer_reviews.title: Battery life is terrible
customer_reviews.text: Battery life is terrible, only 1 day for me. Also app is very hard to use, Does not give you realtime info, only every 10 minutes. Also you cannot set more than 2 zones. I want to be able to set several zones, Home, School, Work, Grandparents, etc.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: ok
customer_reviews.text: I have nothing to compare with but overall the device feels OK. Not very convenient interface. Also after the update I had some issues for a few days. I send feedback (3 times) and finally they answered and fixed the problem. Otherwise it works. The battery lasts about 6 days if you don't overuse the device.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Perfect tracker
customer_reviews.text: Love love this tracker it does everything it says it’s perfect for my 5 yr old to take in his school backpack since he started kindergarten and taking the bus I was worried about him and what might happen. After much research I found this and I’m a happy mom with a peace of mind every day, battery life lasts till Monday-Thursday in only recharge Thursday night and Sunday night the app lets you set a ratio for then the child enters to school and leaves the house and it will send notifications about its location and when battery power starts to run low. I really recommend this Samsung tracker it’s totally worth it
customer_reviews.author: Jennnifer

customer_reviews.title: Dependent on quality of AT&T network
customer_reviews.text: We have this pinned inside my daughters book bag, so if she were to get off the bus at the wrong stop, we’d know where to find her. It’s idea is great but it’s functionality is limited to the quality of the AT&T network, which isn’t the best near us. (I do appreciate its free the first year, then I’ll be figuring out how to move the device to our Verizon network). I deducted a star because it not hard to accidentally turn it off; which she’s apparently done by jostling things in her backpack.
customer_reviews.author: Becky

customer_reviews.title: Can’t rely on this for anything serious.
customer_reviews.text: This tracker has potential but there are so many connectivity problems that it completely defeats the purpose of owning one. It loses the network connection all the time, and has to be reset to make it work again. I was lucky if I got two whole days of being able to find its location. The battery life is nothing like what it advertises, even when we had it on power saving mode. We got this to help keep track of our son to and from school because he has a learning disability, and I had absolutely no faith that this thing would tell me where he was when I needed it to.
customer_reviews.author: S. Kallshian

customer_reviews.title: Software requires phones with >2GB memory and even then it doesn't work!
customer_reviews.text: Tried installing the software on three Android phones. The first two, it wouldn't even let me install because it said it was incompatible with the (fairly modern) phones. The third phone let me install it, but then it kept kicking me back to the phone's home page when I clicked "Login to your Samsung Account". (By the way, they note that not all features are available if you don't sign up for a Samsung account, and then they won't let you access the software without one.) Could not get it to work. And I'm in Electrical Engineering! Don't waste your time. I've read numerous people online who had very similar bad experiences with the software and/or the device.
customer_reviews.author: W. Richman

customer_reviews.title: Useless for pets, terrible battery life
customer_reviews.text: Really wanted to like this but unfortunately it is pretty useless. Battery life is TERRIBLE, lasts less than one day. I currently use Whistle trackers on my dogs and I only have to charge them maybe once a week if they are within wifi range. Also, the "zone" range on this is huge - can't set up a zone smaller than a 700ft radius, which is kind of useless if you want to be alerted if you pet leaves the zone, because it's SO big. Zones with the Whistle can be set much smaller so it's much more practical. Guess I will continue paying the service fee and keep the Whistles.. Bummer!
customer_reviews.author: Mandy

customer_reviews.title: Very Cool and Cost Effective
customer_reviews.text: I needed something in a pinch to help with GPS location when dealing with some family issues. It works perfectly with my SmartThings Hub and the integration is awesome. I also like the cost over maintaining it as other devices can be a bit expensive. I can deal with $5/mo and the savings on a year subscription works. In contrast to Tracki, which I have a well and love, the cost of this makes it perfect FOR ME!. If you need to follow a fleet, this may not be the best. Battery life is acceptable.
customer_reviews.author: Mr Ken

customer_reviews.title: Very reliable and gives me an accurate location every time
customer_reviews.text: Used it to check on my dog when I left him at the sitter. Worked great as I can now verify if the sitter is taking him for his walks twice a day as promised !!!
customer_reviews.author: Tejaswi Javagal

customer_reviews.title: Works fine with one reservation...
customer_reviews.text: Works fine if you're not looking for real-time tracking, which reduces the battery life extensively; however, if you configure it (as it comes out of the box) to send location updates only when requested, through the SmartThings app, then the battery life is fairly good, at four days or so, depending how often you request location updates. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: wpb

customer_reviews.title: durable, good battery life, lots of settings
customer_reviews.text: I love how this has a loop cable to loop it around so many things. This is easy to setup and can be customized quite a bit to fit your needs. If i had to choose one complaint it would be that the button can get played with by little kids and cause the SmartThing to go into some sort of odd mode where it isn't communicating at all. When this happens I hold down on the button for about 30 seconds and shut it completely down and then turn it back on.
customer_reviews.author: roboticsguy1988

customer_reviews.title: Tracker disappeared and so did support.
customer_reviews.text: Worked for about 6 months then it simply disappeared from the Smartthings app. Tracker's blue light indicates it thinks it's working just fine, but it isn't. Just plain gone from my account. After 2 weeks of emails back and forth support stopped replying. Really, really needs a way to hard reset the tracker from the tracker itself. Once activated tracker is stuck to your account. If it vanishes from your app it becomes a useless plastic rectangle.
customer_reviews.author: M. Perry

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic
customer_reviews.text: Love the price and reliability of a Samsung product. Even better: if you buy it here then a year of data is included, but if you buy through the carrier it’s $10ish per month. I put it on my preschooler’s belt loop, and he can’t take it off or play with it. The device has superior range and detection than the other companies like angelsense and is WAY less expensive.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It doesn’t work in Spain !
customer_reviews.text: I bought this device with the sole purpose to use it in Spain. I called the support phone before my order that it will work! Now I am home-3000 miles away and discovered that last time it reported its location was in LA just before my flight. Very disappointed, please contact me with details of how to send it back.
customer_reviews.author: Cristian Serban

customer_reviews.title: Not accurate
customer_reviews.text: I bought this tracker since my daughter started kindergarten this year and it’s a little more peace of mind for me. Today I received an alert that my daughters tracker was in Tennessee and I live in Orlando. I tried to update the location and it didn’t update until now and my daughters has been home for at least three hours. Of course my return window closed yesterday. Don’t waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not reliable.  Don’t waste your money
customer_reviews.text: Am disappointed. The battery barely lasts a couple of days—and that’s when it hasn’t moved and I shut off all location updates so it wouldn’t use as much battery. Now it won’t even sync and just flashes red, which according to the manual means it needs to be charged but it has a full charge. When it actually worked a couple of times it was nice—but is not reliable at all and now doesn’t work period. Spend your money on something else. Update: the day after I posted this review it decided to work again. Doesn’t change my opinion but out of full disclosure wanted to clarify. Not reliable.
customer_reviews.author: Sparkey

customer_reviews.title: BS lies in the description.  Verizon wants $20 a month to activate
customer_reviews.text: Clearly states that its 1 year free data... but when you try to register it, it makes you pay $20 a month.... Absolute scam. Will be returning since it definitely did not offer me free 1 year data. Complete B.S.
customer_reviews.author: Maxamillion

customer_reviews.title: YOU WILL NOT GET NOTIFICATIONS
customer_reviews.text: If you are buying this looking for notifications when entering and/or leaving the user defined zones, look somewhere else. I bought this for my daughter, who walks to school every day. I wanted to get notified when she arrived/left school. But there were 2 problems: 1. I never received a single notification. Spent hours on the phone with support and nothing. 2. The GPS accuracy for the zones is pathetic... The range is so absurdly big, it covers 2 entire blocks... ???!!! So even if I did get a notification, it would have been useless...
customer_reviews.author: Andre M.

customer_reviews.title: Using as a car tacker
customer_reviews.text: I installed it into my son's Volvo. Wired it permanently using one of those power supplies meant for dash cams. The tracker is mounted under the rear shelf padding. Works very well. The only time it cannot get a fix on the GPS signal is when the car is parked in the garage. Got it when it was on sale for seventy two. Good deal at that price.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Ok for Bounty Hunters
customer_reviews.text: This device is very small and IP-rated water and dust proof. I added some neodymium magnets and it’s perfect for tracking bail jumpers and their co-signers. Batteries seem to last long enough and system seems accurate enough to get the job done. Better value and higher quality than the 2G Chinese alternatives - even though the Samsung app is pretty weak.
customer_reviews.author: CrzyShane

customer_reviews.title: Accurate location & good battery life
customer_reviews.text: Very accurate, even if installed in the console. The backend software is the hang-up. The smallest increments for a ping is 10 minutes unless you do Live Tracking which is 10 minutes of 1-minute pings. Costwise it is better than jiobit but jiobit has better backend software.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Walker

customer_reviews.title: Wortless piece of crap
customer_reviews.text: I sent this with my grandaughter on a trip to Ca(disneyland. The traffic direction feature worked wellbut the actual location of her quit when she got to ca. I already knew where she was going (within 100 miles) and this is all it would provide.Protect your children-JUST NOT WITH THIS PRODUCT!!! Update next day: Unit is still not working Went into power savings mode and won't come out! Says to push button on Tracker and hold. How is this feasible when I'm in Ok and it is in Ca.? Man this product has lots of issues that work against its purpose of using to track and protect your child!
customer_reviews.author: kermet sheppard

customer_reviews.title: Not too sure about this one.
customer_reviews.text: Was trying to use it for suitcases and air travel. Not to sure it will work for this purpose. Battery seems to die during transit. It’s too bad I couldn’t plug in a battery to it to extend its life. When plugged in - it doesn’t work as a GPS.
customer_reviews.author: G. Ranimo

customer_reviews.title: Low quality product
customer_reviews.text: I have used a few other types of tracking devices and this is a very low quality product. The battery life on this product starts out lasting for about a week, but recedes rapidly. After two weeks of use it mine doesn't last for more than a couple of days. What makes it worse is that you have to delete the device from your app and set it up from scratch every time it runs our of battery. That's right, it does not remember it's /registration/configuration settings after being recharged. Don't waste your money on this device!
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Neeb

customer_reviews.title: Poor battery life
customer_reviews.text: I get 2 days at most of battery life and that is with automatic position reporting turned off (manual only). It also will not work with my Pixel 2XL, the smartthings app asks to install a controller but that fails so the only way to use the tracker is from an older phone. There is a lot of potential but they need to fix their battery consumption and software problems.
customer_reviews.author: Nate Morley

customer_reviews.title: Not the best app but works
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't seem to notify me of tracker movements, not sure what the issue is. Seems flakey but if you do login to the app it will definitely show you where it's at. And the service is cheap
customer_reviews.author: Lost R.

customer_reviews.title: Safe Zones not practical for pet tracking
customer_reviews.text: This unit has lots of positives. However, the limited function of the safe zone settings makes it not practical for pet tracking. The minimum area of a safe zone is 700' radius. I live on a larger than average lot (5 acers), but still the smallest safe zone crosses 3 roads. I think we should rename this feature to Unsafe Zones! Samsung support told me to return the unit if I am not satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Rueben S.

customer_reviews.title: Does not work as a vehicle tracker
customer_reviews.text: Battery life is not very good, lasts less than a week in energy saving mode. Doesn't power back up when connected to a charger. Also positioning precision is not very good when tracker is moving. Maybe is fine for tracking family members, but does not work as a vehicle tracker, especially if it's not used all the time.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Does it’s job
customer_reviews.text: Have had this for about a year and it works fine. The only gripe is that the single button, with its color coded light, can be a bit confusing to work if you don’t remember what the different combinations mean. Other than that it does what it should.
customer_reviews.author: A. A

customer_reviews.title: When it works, it works. Just don’t expect it to work with any regularity.
customer_reviews.text: Save your money. Every time the battery runs down and it shuts off it needs to be re-paired to the SmartThings app. Every. Single. Time. Zero tech support. I’m not even convinced anyone working at Samsung is aware that they make and sell this product. Total waste of money for me.
customer_reviews.author: JermG!

customer_reviews.title: Not entirely accurate but close enough to comfort
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this item and the value for the free first year is worth it. The tracking can be a bit sporadic when the tracker has not moved but it is close enough to provide idea of proximity within a few yards. The battery life is good if you do not have the location update frequently. Currently set to update each 30 minutes and have to charge it twice a week.
customer_reviews.author: Richey

customer_reviews.title: Precise location when outdoor.
customer_reviews.text: Very affordable GPS tracker out there. Easy to activate. However, the location is off by about 1 block when the device is in the building. Batter life is questionable. I need to charge every other day. Overall, happy with the product.
customer_reviews.author: Sitthiporn S.

customer_reviews.title: Senior
customer_reviews.text: This device is awesome for tracking my senior father. I can rest easy knowing where he is and if he ever wonders off. So far it is working great and I can feel safe that I can find him if something happens. I am very pleased with the Samsung Tracker!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon_Boy

customer_reviews.title: Better off looking else were
customer_reviews.text: Had hi hopes for this device doesn't really show the full map or anything wanted it to track my kid.
customer_reviews.author: Luis alba

customer_reviews.title: Decent but weak battery
customer_reviews.text: Basically it does the job for areas where cellular service is decent, hence, the location tracking is not off much. But the battery is kind of weak, I saw reviews mentioned that it may be able to last for a week, mines are definitely not able to do that, and I’m not pulling the status a lot (considered as a power consuming operation), so I have to charge them about twice a week for daily use.
customer_reviews.author: S. Wang

customer_reviews.title: Great for tracking your little ones
customer_reviews.text: These have really given me peace of mind when my kids go to the park with their teenage babysitter. They’ve worked great for us so far. I researched multiple trackers and I’m glad I chose this one. Battery could last a little longer, but it might just be that I forget to turn them off when they come home.
customer_reviews.author: haven bradley

customer_reviews.title: Decent location sharing device.
customer_reviews.text: Pros: It is very small and convenient. Easy to charge. Cons: Clunky app Battery life 3-4 days max with minimal use. Difficult to update the firmware.
customer_reviews.author: ATr

customer_reviews.title: Not recommend
customer_reviews.text: It can barely track..the location shown is sometimes a mile away from actual and does not help. Not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Swat

customer_reviews.title: Peace of mind!
customer_reviews.text: This little tracker works wonderfully. As long as I keep charging it every 2-3 days I’ll never have to wonder where my dad is. The modes work really well.
customer_reviews.author: Diana C

customer_reviews.title: Low battery life
customer_reviews.text: Overall works good. Biggest issue is battery life. I just leave in the truck plugged up.
customer_reviews.author: Lee R.

customer_reviews.title: Doesnt Set up Properly Keeps Disconnecting
customer_reviews.text: First off thsi device would only setup via Verizon and for a charge instead of the advertised free AT&T service. It kept disconnecting and I had to reregister it THREE times in one day and it kept billing me on Verizon. No one can give me proper tech support, not Amazon, Verizon, or Samsung they all have NO idea what is wrong with the device and why it won't function properly. Should've believed the other reviews that complained about the same issues.
customer_reviews.author: Izzy K

customer_reviews.title: This works like a charm.
customer_reviews.text: The Samsung SmartThings Tracker works as advertised, includes a full year of cell coverage in the price, has remarkably good precision and will go three or four days on a charge. Excellent device.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Smith

customer_reviews.title: The new Smartthings app for android does not work.
customer_reviews.text: My wifes android will not load the required app. My Iphone app works great. I hope Samsung fixes the android app soon.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t work
customer_reviews.text: Never connects and doesn’t work. Worked sporadically for about a week and then would never work again. Huge waste of money and I can’t return it now.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly Ingram

customer_reviews.title: Accurate. 3 day battery life.
customer_reviews.text: Very accuarate. Tiny. Battery life not great though - best to use with a small power bank that extends use to a week.
customer_reviews.author: Veritas

customer_reviews.title: Battery is not enough
customer_reviews.text: I think it solves the problem but I wish gps would pinpoint with smaller radius and battery would last longer.
customer_reviews.author: ag

customer_reviews.title: Like to know what I'm getting
customer_reviews.text: Product description stated that it came with a one year subscription, but I had to pay for a $20 set up with Verizon and $1 a month. Not a lot, but not free either.
customer_reviews.author: jen

customer_reviews.title: Couldn’t keep on child
customer_reviews.text: Could not get attached to child’s clothes where it would not be easy for them to remove. Anyone got ideas on how to keep your child from taking it off?
customer_reviews.author: dangermw

customer_reviews.title: The lanyard attachment may not be reliable.
customer_reviews.text: I used this for my dog. I had it attached to a second collar and put it on he went outside. I found the lanyard intact on the collar and it appears the pin that held the lanyard fell out. Since it was white and in the snow I ran it over with my car. Samsung $100 me $0.
customer_reviews.author: Bj Schweter II

customer_reviews.title: Good kid tracker
customer_reviews.text: Good for tracking kid, while they are at the school and school activities after school.
customer_reviews.author: taylan kuzucu

customer_reviews.title: Great for worried mom
customer_reviews.text: Works great and is very small. Fits easily in a pocket.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Ann

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Love this thing. My dog is a runner, and this has helped me find him fast. It even gives the address of the location.
customer_reviews.author: kellie

customer_reviews.title: Works poorly
customer_reviews.text: This thing is so kludgy that it might technically do whats advertised, but when it doesnt you just dont care to try to fix it cause it never did anything reliably
customer_reviews.author: Michael L. Stanley

customer_reviews.title: Nice Tracker but no way to renew
customer_reviews.text: I was not able to find any way to renew the subscription to AT&T. So if you are planning to purchase this know that you may need to get a new one after an year. Still if you get it discounted at about 80 dollars it is still the cheapest way to have GPS tracker for a year.
customer_reviews.author: NKA

customer_reviews.title: sad I have to let it go
customer_reviews.text: battery life is half of what is advertised . Thus it is useless.
customer_reviews.author: !root

customer_reviews.title: GPS with 10000ft accuracy!!!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: How can a GPS be accurate to 10000 ft??? It’s more like a PS rather than a GPS. Save some time and money. Company like Samsung producing this product is so pathetic.
customer_reviews.author: Ish

customer_reviews.title: Fast shipment.
customer_reviews.text: Everything on this order was fine. I got a great product at a great price. Well packaged and fast shipment.
customer_reviews.author: mojobill

customer_reviews.title: Works ok, but battery life is terrible
customer_reviews.text: Battery only lasts 2-3 days, even without location updates. I have it hidden in my scooter, and will get an alert when it leaves a zone. I have to recharge it every 2 days.
customer_reviews.author: Levinson

customer_reviews.title: Too expensive for what it does. It is just a toy
customer_reviews.text: It doesn't show the address only the approximate location, also don't record the 👣 trail on the map
customer_reviews.author: Julio

customer_reviews.title: expert wanted
customer_reviews.text: Too hard to understand: you really can not tell if GPS is turn on or off and if you lose it then it does not make noise. Not happy with it
customer_reviews.author: ARTHUR PLETT

customer_reviews.title: Poor battery life, unable to use external battery pack to keep charged.
customer_reviews.text: Works for daily use, but has to be recharged a lot. I like the one year free service. It's pretty accurate.
customer_reviews.author: Review

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Solution
customer_reviews.text: I almost never write reviews but thought I would on this SmartThings Tracker because its so awesome. It works as advertised and it comes with a year of service so its something i would highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great choice
customer_reviews.text: This lasts about 2-3 days and the tracking application is pretty accurate. This device is well worth the price without the hassle of those subscription services being offered with other devices.
customer_reviews.author: lindsay mcgee

customer_reviews.title: Bad seller?
customer_reviews.text: It literally won't sync, it doesn't even blinl red green, its only blinking blue and it won't connect, I suspect it's still tracking from the previous owner which is dumb
customer_reviews.author: Kevin S.

customer_reviews.title: Not a functioning device
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't show device any longer. Unable to add new device.
customer_reviews.author: Kingsman

customer_reviews.title: Not working internationally
customer_reviews.text: I bought it after asking Samsung support if it's working internationally and they confirmed on that, but when the iteam arrived I found that there is no place for Sim card to be changed and It has only AT&T SIM card. So, It didn't work in Egypt.
customer_reviews.author: diana

customer_reviews.title: Battery life is weak.
customer_reviews.text: Very kool for large items, like a car; however, battery life is unacceptable.
customer_reviews.author: Capt. G

customer_reviews.title: Don't Buy Second Hand
customer_reviews.text: Never buy this product second hand. If the previous owner didn't delete this from their Samsung Account, you cannot use this device because theres no way to reset the connection remotely. Money wasted...
customer_reviews.author: demir

customer_reviews.title: Works!
customer_reviews.text: Compact size and the set up was very easy. Using it to track my dog and it works very well.
customer_reviews.author: Flying Carpet

customer_reviews.title: Needs accelerometer
customer_reviews.text: Would be good to have accelerometer to know the speed at which tracker is traveling.
customer_reviews.author: oarp

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Works well. A little tedious if you are looking to keep constant tabs on something(reason for only four stars). But for the price, great product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It’s worth getting
customer_reviews.text: I have the tracker attached to my 92-year-old father’s key ring, and it works great. I am so glad I found it. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Overall it’s good but the battery life is not good it says 5 days but it last 2 days
customer_reviews.author: Hui Ma

customer_reviews.title: Distance of actual tracker and location on Map is 1500 feet, become difficult to find
customer_reviews.text: Pros: good in coverage Cons: map location is not accurate, it is showing 1500+ feet distance.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Battery and geofence Ad/DC powered
customer_reviews.text: Battery only last for 2-3 days. Geofence- no option to txt you if object leaves. Makes you use notifications. Works when charging.
customer_reviews.author: Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t work!
customer_reviews.text: Need a refund as product doesn’t even work in my country. So it’s perplexing as to why they would send it to me in the first place?
customer_reviews.author: James Osborn

customer_reviews.title: Didn't Work
customer_reviews.text: Couldn't get to activate, even after talking with Verizon directly
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: Tiny GPS tracker with 1 year cellular data
customer_reviews.text: This tiny GPS tracker looks sleeker and slimmer than any other out there. I would soon love to find out the actual battery life. It is such a good deal to have 1 year free cellular service included in the package ... Is this for limited time only? It works well both indoors and outdoors but it doesn’t beep...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Reliable gps tracking device
customer_reviews.text: Very accurate, I bought 2 for my car and wife car
customer_reviews.author: Rgf

product_meta.title: Samsung SmartThings Tracker | Live GPS Tracking Via Nationwide LTE| Track Locations of Kids, Car, Keys, Pet, Wallet, Luggage, and More | Small Compact Lightweight 1.7 x1.7 in | White
product_meta.description: Style:TrackerThe Samsung SmartThings Tracker is an on-demand GPS tracking device connected through the LTE network that allows you to track children, pets, and valuable items like keys and your wallet. The GPS tracker is LTE-based, so you can track further than traditional Bluetooth supported devices. You’ll have peace of mind knowing the real-time location of your valuables and loved ones when they’re on the move via the free smartphone SmartThings app. The SmartThings Tacker can also connect to other smart devices to automatically lock doors, turn off lights, and much more, when the tracker enters certain zones you can set. One full year of AT&T service is included for the first 12 months at no additional charge. After the first 12 months, the cost is $5 per month or $50 per year. Disclosures: Coverage based on AT&T LTE-M network. No AT&T service-based smartphone is required. SmartThings app download is required, and tracker is not supported outside of the U.S. Battery life may vary based on factors such as device settings, usage patterns and operating conditions. Device has a water-resistance rating of Ip68, which tests submersion up to 5 feet for up to 30 minutes. Tracker is made of plastic, measures 1.7” x 1.7” x 0.5” and weighs 0.05 lbs. Package includes tracker, battery, power adapter, data cable, and OSG.
feature_bullets: Keep Tabs, Keep Calm: Have the ability to quickly and accurately locate your loved ones or most-valued items in real time; See their live locations on your smartphone via the SmartThings app

LTE-Based: View the tracker’s location within the range of a cellular network; Device is LTE-based for monitoring indoor and outdoor locations, and can be attached to kids backpacks, keychains, dog & cat collars, wallets, and more

1 Year Free Service: AT&T cellular service is included for the first 12 months at no additional charge; After that, service cost is dollar 5 a month or dollar 50 per year; AT&T service-based smartphone is not required
Kid Alerts: When your child is ready to be picked up, they can press the power button 2x to send their real-time location through the app; If they’re in trouble, they can send an SOS
Track More, Worry Less: Battery offers a week’s worth of power on a single charge; It’s IP68 water resistant and protects against splashes, spills, accidental water submersion & weather conditions

Create Zone Alerts: Create zones that will automatically alert you when the tracker enters in or out, and set connected devices like door locks, lights, AC, and more to turn on and off based on entering & leaving those zones

specifications.Included Components: Tracker, QSG, Travel Adapter, Strap, Data Cable
